did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Peter A. Schweitzer papers 1916-2005 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Established in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. Peter A. Schweitzer was an executive with JWT in the New York and Detroit offices, serving as Chief Executive Officer of the agency 2001-2004. Collection spans the years 1916-2005 with the bulk of materials spanning 1980-2000 and includes texts for speeches and presentations, correspondence and other administrative records, printed materials, photographs and slides, and audiovisual materials (audio and video cassettes, CDs and DVDs) that primarily document Schweitzer's career as an executive, especially with JWT's Detroit Office. Companies represented in the collection include Brouillard Communications, Burger King, Ford, Kodak, Kraft, Nestlé, Rolex, and Unilever. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Unpublished materials are closed to non-JWT researchers for 15 years from the date of creation.
Original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Technical Services staff need to produce use copies before contents can be accessed.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Peter A. Schweitzer Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Peter A. Schweitzer Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2006-2007.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions 2006-0046, 2007-0035 were merged into one collection, described in this collection guide.

chronitem.event: General Foods, manufacturing and marketing management
Management Supervisor, JWT New York Office (Warner-Lambert account)
Vice President, Group Management Supervisor (Burger King account), JWT
Executive Vice President, JWT USA; General Manager, JWT Detroit Office; elected to JWT Board of Directors
Named President and Chief Operating Officer of JWT; Worldwide Director of Ford account
Relinquish title of Chief Operating Officer, JWT, to concentrate on Ford account
Chairman, JWT; Retired from JWT later in year

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection spans the years 1916-2005 with the bulk of materials spanning 1980-2000 and includes texts for speeches and presentations, correspondence and other administrative records, printed materials, photographs and slides, and audiovisual materials (audio and video cassettes, CDs and DVDs) that primarily document Schweitzer's career as an executive, especially with JWT's Detroit Office. Companies represented in the collection include Brouillard Communications, Burger King, Ford, Kodak, Kraft, Nestlé, Rolex, and Unilever.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection arranged into seven series: Account Files; Administrative Files; New Business Records; Printed Materials; Writings and Speeches; Large-Format Materials; and Audiovisual Materials.
